channel.title: LatAm Prompt News Digest
channel.description: A daily digest of curated Latin American news.

item.title: LatAm Prompt News Digest - August 18, 2025
item.author: LatAm Prompt News Feed
item.description:
Bolivians Vote Out Socialists After Two Decades in Power — The Wall Street Journal

Voters angered by soaring inflation and fuel shortages back market-friendly candidates to overhaul Bolivia’s economy.

Opinion | Don’t Bomb Mexico, Mr. President — The Wall Street Journal

There are better ways of fighting the drug cartels—and Claudia Sheinbaum will help.

Once a place of horror, now a tourist town - with an uncertain future — BBC

Chile wants to turn the site where a cult leader tortured prisoners and abused his followers into a memorial.

Colombia’s Opposition Is Hobbled by Senator’s Murder, Leader’s Scandal — Bloomberg

Colombia’s Opposition Is Hobbled by Senator’s Murder, Leader’s Scandal

Trump pressure lights fire under Mexico’s ‘powder keg’ ruling party — The Financial Times

President Sheinbaum grapples with power vacuum left by her mentor and predecessor López Obrador

The judge who refuses to bend to Trump’s will: ‘We’ll do what’s right’ — The Washington Post

Alexandre de Moraes says he’s preserving Brazilian democracy. The White House says he’s destroying it.
